comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Feb 6, 1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03EFD6143EE033A... in column 4 includes a piece on the newly opened Varick House, a modern hotel for working women. The sewing room is mentioned. Also part of the 6-storey 8-room facility were a gymnasium with running track and a yard and basketball court.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This March 7, 1915 piece in the Pittsburgh Press recounts a visit to Varick House, at 11 Dominick St., a home-like boarding house for "working girls" not over 35 and not making more than $15 per week. There are 2 photos, but not from Bain. news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1144&dat=19150307&...
